isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - ENGINE WARNING LIGHTS

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect engine warning light circuits and connectors as outlined in paragraph Before Troubleshooting.

The yellow Check Engine Light (CEL) and the red Stop Engine Light (SEL) should come on for several seconds, then go out as part of the ECM start-up procedure. The lights should also be illuminated when certain faults codes are active. If either or both of these lights do not come on during the key-ON start-up test, perform Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Do Not Operate test procedure.
If either or both of these lights stays ON and there are no active fault codes, perform Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Stays ON test procedure.

svcsubproc.title: Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Do Not Operate
Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Stays On
